Text:
i liked how he walked through cake php application tasks with the class. This allowed us to work alongside the professor and make sure
we didnt run into any technical errors. I also liked how the exams were paper based and not computing hands on. This truly allows the
student to show what they know, without having the pressure of a time constraint and possible tech glitches.

The class was very open and provided an environment where questions were welcome. The powerpoints were straight forward and
easy to learn from. The use of Lynda videos to cover additional material was also very welcome as there can only be so much taught in a short period of time.
Hands on tech challenges & project
In class demonstrations and walk throughs
The in-class exercises and examples.
His curriculum to make a app helped me learning the course.
In-class exercises, class lectures, technologies used in class (PDO, ajax, json), final project.

The powerpoints and quizzes provided a clear outline of what we were expected to take out of each lesson and made it easy to review
the material. Lectures were clear and helpful
Emphasis of material through exercises, challenges, and quizzes

This was definitely one of my favorite classes of my whole college career for a few reasons: 1. Professor Shafer was great! He is so
passionate about the material and you can tell that he really enjoys teaching it. This makes me excited to learn it too! 2. The project was fantastic in that we had a lot of room to create whatever we wanted to create and test out our coding skills. It was very challenging but very rewarding. I will say I found myself procrastinating work on other classes by working on my app for a couple of weeks because it
was such an interesting project and, with the competitive aspect, I wanted my app to be the best. I also like the way that the course is
structured with spending 2/3 of the semester learning new tools that we can use on the project which we work on in the final 1/3 of the
semester.
Related examples as well as going over solutions.
Always helpful. Shafer is an amazing professor!
knowledgeable professor
Hands on learning
Having live examples in class to work on.
Hands on challenges
The class presentations, and the class captures.
This was an extremely difficult course for an MIS elective.
Using challenges and hands-on exercise to teach programming languages
Free to ask any questions.
The actual knowledge of JavaScript and jQuery
Weekly Challenges and the resources which the instructor pointed us to.
a
Not much.
The prototype project since it forced students to apply and integrate various concepts to create a cohesive application.
Professor Shafer is a very intelligent man who knows what he is teaching about.

Professor Shafers challenges and quizzes are great preparation for the exams as well as helping to learn the code. He really does
expand the knowledge base of code.
Weekly ungraded quizzes, thorough feedback & time working on projects in class.

I really enjoyed the group project. It gave us the chance to use the skills we learned in 3501 to build something cool. Also, Shafer was
always so accommodating and willing to help with any issues we may have come across.
Professor Shafer is great at helping students understand code by thinking of it in English terms.
lectures are good! challenges and project helps to practice

The class challenges were helpful in contributing to my learning. Being in groups was a great idea because coding is done better with
more than one mind.

He is open to all questions - actively engaging in the material through discussion is most effective for me. He is extremely
knowledgeable and a great resource.
Ungraded quizzes, class capture
Knowledgeable
Exam review 2 was fantastic. Watch the class capture and model your future exam reviews after that.
This course was a fun spin on coding, the hands-on approach to everything and being able to use the challenges on the final project helped a lot
Going over challenges in class, being able to show mine and having it critiqued in class was very helpful.
I think the project and the ungraded quizzes were the biggest factors to my understanding of the material in this course.
The project helped a lot for me to really learn what it feels like to code a web application from scratch.
Knowledgable about course content, willing to assist.
the exam prep was really helpful

I loved Professor Shafers class!! The opportunity to build something concrete for a client was invaluable. Professor Shafer designed the
structure of the deliverables in a way that was very manageable and I will use the same approach if I ever decide to build my own app
some day. Working on a project like this was the best way to learn the concepts that Professor Shafer taught. As always, he is
engaging in class, uses fun analogies and is very relatable.
The project forced me to understand the code more than surface level.
He explains the material thoroughly when asked

Although Im not big into coding its clear the Professor enjoys his work and puts much effort into making the course interesting. I learned
a lot and believe itll provide value for me in my career. If I had the mindset for programming Id definitely sign up for advanced levels
taught by him.
It was very hands on
The instructor was always available to help with assignments, and was willing to help students even outside of office hours.
The semester long group project.
we learned php, html, java and so on.
Working on challenges and exercises in class.
Shafer is a great professor and really informative. Teaches both 3501 & 3502 well.

Professor Shafer is an awesome teacher and person and he is always willing to help when we ask. This is particularly helpful with the
project and troubleshooting
code examples and lecture
Prof. Shafer did a great job communicating deliverables and exam guide were very helpful.
Very friendly and enthusiastic everyday in class.
Class capture--rewatching the lectures really help with understanding the material. I also like the pace of the course.
Shafer is a really nice guy. He cares about his students, which i really appreciate. once he lowered the expectation of our project deliverable because he thought it might be too high

Always a pleasure being taught by Shafer, great person and Professor. He really is catering to the skill level of the students with how he
shaped the project deliverables and that is greatly appreciated.

The in-class presentations/exercises/challenges definitely helped me to practice what we were being taught and contributing to my
learning. I also think that completing the class project was a huge help in my learning because it forced us to really apply the concepts
that we were learning in class to an actual project.

Ungraded quizzes were a good tool for learning and studying, The slides used in class were also very good and useful to refer to for
challenges as well as exams.
He was very clear about his requirements and always addressed student needs
I loved the challenge of this class.
Honestly this class is about teaching yourself and therefore the instructor contributed very little.
Course is VERY HARD, but everything is there. Presentation slides, book, challenge files, and class capture
You rock Shafer, thank you for a great semester. Youve been consistently one of my favorite professors in my time here at Temple.
Clarify of explanations.
Hands on challenges helped, but I dont think enough time was spent on them.
Content was both fun and explained very clearly

I retook the class after not passing in the spring. I found that the changes to the project made the class much easier, especially as it required less time spent on it and allowed me to spend more time on other classwork and studying. The new project also prevented
groups from falling behind the way mine did last semester.. The labs are hugely helpful, especially discussing them in class. The
lectures are great, if I missed one I would always watch the class capture.
Really does a great job at answering questions and clarifying information. Shows really good examples
he is helpful during office hours and during class if you ask questions
Shaffer knows what hes doing with the code, and will offer help.

Professor Shafer was by far my favorite professor at temple university. He helped me find a passion for development and helped me
expand my knowledge on the skill. He keeps class entertaining and interesting. He is fair and pushes you to put in the work outside of
the classroom. His lectures are challenging but informative and the man is a genius.
His ability to help everyone
Not many, a lot of self learning

Lectures on Tuesdays and applying the knowledge to the term-long project was a great way of teaching and I enjoyed how the material
was taught.
The instructors care for the students
Instruct on the project - apply knowledge to our project
Professor Shafer is a nice and approachable teacher. He is always open to questions and provides as much help as he can.

His examples of how to code and develop everything was nearly perfect. If you listen to what he teaches it is clear that you can learn a
lot from his work

I liked the idea of the project. I feel as though I did not have to know a heavy amount of code, which is perfect for the program. Getting
a brief overview of the code to become familiar is what I signed up for. I also liked the exams, I think that multiple choice questions were
good and the exams werent unnecessarily difficult.
Great professor, hard class to teach but he did a great job.
I had to self-teach myself a lot, which is when I learned the most. There is only so much you can learn in the classroom, especially when it comes to coding.
Detailed explanations and teaching by example are awesome!

Class captures were by far the most useful thing in this class. Often times I would struggle in the class, only to go back to the class
capture and realize my mistake and fix it.
The instructor always came to class with upbeat energy and you can feel he is very passionate about the topic. He explains clearly what he expects and recommends resources to help.
Project was really helpful. Quizzes were very helpful to study for the exams.
Hands on learning. Passionate teaching.

Professor Shafer is a great teacher, the biggest detriment to my grade is that I was forced to take MIS 2402 prior to this class instead of
MIS 3501 for which this particular class was designed to follow. It is as though I started behind the curve in this class and had to race to
catch up.

The in-class practical solutions and examples. He takes his time to answer most of he question. His office hours were incredibly helpful.
He offered one to one coaching, both in class and outside of class.
He clearly went over each topic and made everyone feel comfortable learning it.
He is extremely friendly and makes it a comfortable environment to ask questions.

Shafer is very knowledgeable and comfortable teaching students this type of material. The code alongs helped a lot in the beginning. The homework exercises helped immensely when it came time to do the project. Having the class capture helped too.
Amazing proffessor always there to help and was available all the time.
Very engaging, helped us to learn the content.
Enthusiasm and profound knowledge.
The project was the best part of the class and helped me learned the most.
Professor Shafer is extremely well though out in his teaching. He cares for his students and actually wants you to learn!!
Very knowledgeable, provided in class exercises that connected to the teaching points.
Walking through assignments and code in general
I learned a great deal of JavaScript, especially the fact that I did not learn it at all before this class.
He is a very dedicated, knowledgable, and friendly professor. He always helps students and wants the best for his students. I really enjoy having him as my professor.

how the beginning of the course was set up to walk us through the assignments in class and then leave the on your own pieces of work
was very helpful. Class capture is also extremely helpful.
Professor was clearly enthusiastic about the course content and made it more comfortable to ask questions and make mistakes.
The open class environment where we worked with the professor and our classmates to code.
The class lectures and studio time
very willing to help

I like the set up of the class where the eight assignments and lectures are in the first half of the semester. Then on the second half we
just apply what we learned on the RentZen project.
He actually walks us through some examples and doesnt just tell us to figure it out

During studio session days, Professor Shafer offered one on one help with any aspects of the code that students may have found
confusing or were struggling with. He was always gentle in his explanation and never made students feel as though they were behind or
dumb for not understanding concepts.

The instructor is very friendly and kind. He also explains course objectives and assignments step-by-step so its easily understandable,
and very helpful.
Great explanation on coding parts.
Working on the assignments in class and getting us started
style of teaching
the in class exercises were very helpful

I loved this class. The instructor came to class prepared and was very helpful. He was very knowledgeable about the course material
and passionate about teaching. Really cared about students.
Hands on learning approach, provides really helpful feedback

He was a saint with answering questions and ACTUALLY explaining material in class. I am not a good coder, nor do I think I will ever
be, but this man really dumbed down a lot of explanations of code to us, you have no idea how much I appreciated this.
approachability and communication

Shafer leads a classroom environment that is open, criticism-free,
and enjoyable to be a part of. Not only does he make learning fun, but Professor Shafer brings his whole self to work to make sure students are learning. One of my
favorite professors!

I really appreciated how willing the professor was in guiding us
through the work instead of letting us struggle.

Professor Shafer has a very easy-going and relaxed teaching style
that really helps students learn without the material becoming too stressful.

The professor actually trying to teach everything in the course. I
had shaffer for 2402 and he explained every detail and that hasn't changed in this class either which is fantastic.

Nothing. Professor Shafer is a really great guy and you can tell he
cares a great deal about his students. However, this course is a lot of hard coding for the second level coding class. With only two exams and one project it makes it hard
to keep a good grade in the course.
Went over the programming excerices well!
Environment that encouraged questions
The project we did in the second half of the semester.
His passion and love for the content!

Professor Shafer is very helpful at reviewing all the coding stuff. For
me, All code are hard to remember clearly. He explains these codes very detail and easy to understand.

On hands learning, so when we would go through the code
together and he would explain why we are doing that specific thing.
walking through each and every step during coding

Professor Shafer is a great teacher and extremely caring. He knows
a lot about the subject material and explained it well. He was very approachable with questions, as well as the ITA and Diamond Peer teacher.I learned a lot in this class
because of him.
The at home assignments

Example code and Nhi's review sessions literally saved me. I'm
really slow when it comes to coding but once I saw example's and went to Nhi's review session everything became 1,000 times more clear.

Good communication about what was going on. Helpful with
transition to online class.

The assignments helped me understand the concepts we were
learning, in addition to the quizzes. The review sessions prior to the exams were also beneficial. Following along for the project was also very helpful.

I learned more detailed information about Nod.js and Html with
server side's part. Moreover, AWS was very easy to understand.

Professor Shafer's approach in teaching the course through a
hands-on learning with throrough explanations helped most with my learning.

Professor Shafer is very nice. He will explain the course concepts
step by step which is very clear. And he always stresses the points that we will easy to forget several times. The TA also helps our projects and assignments in office hours
if we have any problems.

Weekly graded coding assignments and quizzes motivated me to
learn the material and in turn improved my understanding of core concepts around client and server-side web development

The professor slowly and clearly does code demonstrations and
asks for class input. The professor answers questions in great detail to ensure that everyone understands course concepts.
